review: Would not recommend unless you have a new TV.  Here's why: It worked for a couple months and then 'HDCP Unauthorised' messages started appearing. Everything I read online says your TV is too old in this case.  This cannot be the case because it worked perfectly fine for a while. I'm guessing some auto software update to the stick broke it because my Roku still works fine with that TV. Either way, the device now works for games and apps but cannot show any actual video content using Amazon Prime, HBO Go, or anything else.  I searched high and low for an answer to the issue and apparently the only workaround is to get a hdmi splitter that ignores HDCP. Many people point to workarounds like unplugging the tv, unplugging the stick, unplugging your router, etc. None of that stuff worked for me, nor should anyone have to resort to such silliness. I guess I'm going back to my Roku..
